result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ronald D. Hayes Jr. was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Fine is to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for the Fine.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.  Court has no objection to sentence being served in another jurisdiction provided the Defendant can make the appropriate arrangements.  Pursuant to s. 346.65(7), Wis. Stats., Defendant shall be required to remain in the County Jail for not less than a 48 consecutive hour period prior to release for Huber.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald D. Hayes Jr.

Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: All Cases Called @ 11:25 AM: Defendant Ronald D. Hayes in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Resolution recited by DA.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Def agrees with 2 prior convictions as recited by Court.   Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea OWI 3:  NC Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 dismissed outright - 15TR-2609 and 15TR-2610 both DRI.  Argument by Atty Selsing as to Ab Sobriety condition.  Argument by DA as to Ab Sobriety condition.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Will follow Joint Recommendation.  S/W - 18  mos probation.  Conditions: 45 days WCJ, GT and Huber, No TS credit, Report Forthwith - Mandatory 48 hr requirement prior to release for Huber, No objection to transfer of SEH to Winnebago Co if can be arranged; AODA and any follow thru as recommended;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; $1744 Fine plus $42.50 draw fee, 24 mos DL Rev with credit for any Adm suspension period; IID for 24 mos - Def advised that he will now have a waiting period before Occ DL can be reinstated; DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given
from Atty Selsing Re: Request to Adjourn 1/13/2016 P/S Hrg

NOT PUT OF RECORD. Attorney John B. Selsing in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Selsing states matter can be set for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.    No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

15CM-393, 15TR-2609 and 15TR-2610: Defendant Ronald D. Hayes in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  DA serves Amended Complaint - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered as to all matters.  DA argues as to bond - no cash previously posted.  Argues for $1500 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No objection as to bond request.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
